title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 

- Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 8th day of June

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 3. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-
text_raw:
3. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-

19) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 121 of 2020) are revoked. 

Definitions

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
4. 

In these Regulations - 

“Act of 1947” means the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947); 

“Act of 2001” means the Local Government Act 2001 (No. 37 of 2001); 

“applicable person” means a person whose place of residence is located within 
a relevant geographical location; 

“permitted outlet” means an outlet of a type specified in Schedule 1; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [206] 3 

“place of residence”, in relation to an applicable person, means - 

(a) 

(b) 

the home in which the person is currently residing, or 

if the person does not have a home or is not residing in his or her 
home, such other premises, if any, at which he or she is 
currently residing, whether on a permanent or temporary basis. 

“relevant geographical location” means a geographical location to which an 
affected areas order applies. 

Restriction of movement of applicable persons in relation to exercise and 
social or recreational purposes
text_norm: 4 regulation - act 1947 mean health act 1947 (no 28 1947) act 2001 mean local government act 2001 (no 37 2001) applicable person mean person whose place residence located within relevant geographical location permitted outlet mean outlet type specified schedule 1 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 9th june 2020 206 3 place residence relation applicable person mean - (a) (b) home person currently residing person home residing home premise currently residing whether permanent temporary basis relevant geographical location mean geographical location affected area order applies restriction movement applicable person relation exercise social recreational purpose

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 5. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2) to (4), an applicable person shall not
text_raw:
5. (1) Subject to paragraphs (2) to (4), an applicable person shall not 
engage or otherwise participate in relevant activities outside his or her place of 
residence (in this Regulation referred to as the “relevant residence”). 

(2) An applicable person may, within the county in which the relevant 
residence is situated or in another county provided the person is within a 20 
kilometre radius of the relevant residence - 

(a) 

(b) 

exercise outdoors alone, 

exercise outdoors - 

(i) with other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) with a maximum of 14 other persons who do not reside in 

the relevant residence, or 

(iii) with a maximum of 14 other persons, where one or more 
such other persons resides in the relevant residence and 
one or more of such other persons does not so reside, 

(c) 

go out alone for recreational purposes, 

(d) gather together indoors for social or recreational purposes - 

(i) with other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) with a maximum of 5 other persons who do not reside in 

the relevant residence, or 

(iii) with a maximum of 5 other persons, where one or more of 
such other persons resides in the relevant residence and 
one or more of such other persons does not so reside, or 

(e) 

gather together outdoors for social or recreational purposes - 

(i) with other persons residing in the relevant residence, 

(ii) with a maximum of 14 other persons who do not reside in 

the relevant residence, or 

(iii) with a maximum of 14 other persons, where one or more 
of such other persons resides in the relevant residence and 
one or more of such other persons does not so reside. 

(3) An applicable person may visit the place of residence of a vulnerable 
person for social or recreational purposes and gather together in that place of 

 
 
 4 [206] 

residence for such purposes with the vulnerable person and a maximum of 4 
other persons. 

(4) An applicable person may engage or otherwise participate in 

training relating to a sport, where - 

(a) 

the person, in respect of the sport concerned - 

(i) 

(ii) 

is in receipt of financial support provided by Sport Ireland 
under the scheme commonly known and referred to as the 
Sport Ireland International Carding Scheme, 

competes at a senior level and is a participant in a high 
performance training programme of the national governing 
body of the sport, which body receives, from Sport 
Ireland, financial support commonly known and referred 
to as the Sport Ireland High Performance Programme 
Funding, or 

(iii) 

is a professional sportsperson who receives payment for 
training and playing the sport under a contract of 
employment with a soccer club or the rugby football 
organisation commonly known and referred to as the Irish 
Rugby Football Union, 

the training is supervised by a member of staff of Sport Ireland, 
a coach or a trainer, and 

it is in the best interests of the ongoing improvement, 
maintenance or enhancement of the person’s performance in that 
sport to undergo such training. 

(b) 

(c) 

(5) In this Regulation – 

“county”, subject to paragraph (6), has the same meaning as it has in section 10 
(amended by section 12 of the Local Government Reform Act 2014 (No. 1 of 
2014)) of the Act of 2001, being a Local Government Area that is listed as a 
County in Schedule 5 to the Act of 2001; 

“relevant activities” means activities that are engaged or otherwise participated 
in solely for - 

(a) 

(b) 

social or recreational purposes, or 

the purposes of exercise; 

“social or recreational purposes” includes leisure or holiday purposes; 

“vulnerable person” means - 

(a) 

(b) 

a person who normally requires assistance in carrying out his or 
her daily activities, 

a person who, although not normally requiring assistance in 
carrying out his or her daily activities, requires such assistance 
because he or she is - 

(i) 

particularly susceptible to the risk posed to health by 
Covid-19, or 

 
 [206] 5 

(ii) not in a position to leave his or her place of residence due 
to reasons related to the spread of Covid-19 or otherwise, 
or 

(c) 

a child. 

(6) For the purposes of these Regulations, a group of Local Government 
Areas specified in one of the following subparagraphs shall be deemed to be a 
single county: 

(a) Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown, Fingal, South Dublin and Dublin 

City; 

(b) Cork and Cork City; 

(c) Galway and Galway City; 

(d) Limerick City and County; 

(e) Waterford City and County. 

Restriction on events

(a) (b) exercise outdoors alone exercise outdoors - (i) person residing relevant residence (ii) maximum 14 person reside relevant residence (iii) maximum 14 person one person resides relevant residence one person reside (c) go alone recreational purpose (d) gather together indoors social recreational purpose - (i) person residing relevant residence (ii) maximum 5 person reside relevant residence (iii) maximum 5 person one person resides relevant residence one person reside (e) gather together outdoors social recreational purpose - (i) person residing relevant residence (ii) maximum 14 person reside relevant residence (iii) maximum 14 person one person resides relevant residence one person reside (3) applicable person may visit place residence vulnerable person social recreational purpose gather together place 4 206 residence purpose vulnerable person maximum 4 person (4) applicable person may engage otherwise participate training relating sport - (a) person respect sport concerned - (i) (ii) receipt financial support provided sport ireland scheme commonly known referred sport ireland international carding scheme competes senior level participant high performance training programme national governing body sport body receives sport ireland financial support commonly known referred sport ireland high performance programme funding (iii) professional sportsperson receives payment training playing sport contract employment soccer club rugby football organisation commonly known referred irish rugby football union training supervised member staff sport ireland coach trainer best interest ongoing improvement maintenance enhancement person performance sport undergo training (b) (c) (5) regulation - county subject paragraph (6) meaning section 10 (amended section 12 local government reform act 2014 (no 1 2014)) act 2001 local government area listed county schedule 5 act 2001 relevant activity mean activity engaged otherwise participated solely - (a) (b) social recreational purpose purpose exercise social recreational purpose includes leisure holiday purpose vulnerable person mean - (a) (b) person normally requires assistance carrying daily activity person although normally requiring assistance carrying daily activity requires assistance - (i) particularly susceptible risk posed health covid-19 206 5 (ii) position leave place residence due reason related spread covid-19 otherwise (c) child (6) purpose regulation group local government area specified one following subparagraphs shall deemed single county (a) dun laoghaire-rathdown fingal south dublin dublin city (b) cork cork city (c) galway galway city (d) limerick city county (e) waterford city county restriction event

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 6. (1) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, an event for
text_raw:
6. (1) A person shall not organise, or cause to be organised, an event for 
cultural, entertainment, recreational, sporting, social, community or educational 
reasons other than – 

(a) where one or both of the following applies: 

(i) 

(ii) 

the maximum number of persons attending, or proposed to 
attend, the event (for whatever reason) does not exceed 15 
persons; 

the person organising the event or causing the event to be 
organised takes all reasonable steps to ensure that the 
number of persons attending, or proposed to attend, the 
event (for whatever reason) does not exceed 15 persons, or 

(b) where the event is for educational reasons, it is held, or to be 
held, in a school, university, higher education facility, crèche or 
other registered childcare facility. 

(2) Paragraph (1) is a penal provision for the purposes of section 31A of 

the Act of 1947. 

Carrying on or provision of relevant business or service
text_norm: 6 (1) person shall organise cause organised event cultural entertainment recreational sporting social community educational reason - (a) one following applies (i) (ii) maximum number person attending proposed attend event (for whatever reason) exceed 15 person person organising event causing event organised take reasonable step ensure number person attending proposed attend event (for whatever reason) exceed 15 person (b) event educational reason held held school university higher education facility creche registered childcare facility (2) paragraph (1) penal provision purpose section 31a act 1947 carrying provision relevant business service

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 7. (1) A relevant person shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that
text_raw:
7. (1) A relevant person shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that 
members of the public are not permitted, or otherwise granted, access to a 
premises in a relevant geographical location, or to a part of such premises, 
where a relevant business or service is carried on or otherwise provided. 

(2) Paragraph (1) is a penal provision for the purposes of section 31A of 

the Act of 1947. 

(3) For the avoidance of doubt, paragraph (1) does not prohibit - 

 
 
 
 
 6 [206] 

(a) 

(b) 

the filming or other recording of performances in a theatre, 
concert hall, museum or art gallery, without an audience present, 
for the purposes of broadcasting such performances on the 
internet, radio or television, 

the holding of horseracing or greyhound racing at a racecourse, 
where no persons are in attendance at the racecourse solely for 
the purposes of spectating such racing, or 

(c) 

the use of a premises, or part of a premises, for the purposes of - 

(i) 

(ii) 

a meeting of a local authority (within the meaning of the 
Act of 2001), or 

a sitting of one or both Houses of the Oireachtas or a 
committee thereof (within the meaning of section 2 of the 
Houses of the Oireachtas (Inquiries, Privileges and 
Procedures) Act 2013 (No. 33 of 2013). 

(4) 

In this Regulation - 

“relevant business or service” means a business or service of a type specified in 
Schedule 2; 

“relevant person”, in relation to a relevant business or service, means - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the occupier, 

the manager, or 

any other person for the time being in charge, 

of the premises, or part of the premises, concerned. 

 
 
 
 
 [206] 7 

Regulation 4
text_norm: 7 (1) relevant person shall take reasonable step ensure member public permitted otherwise granted access premise relevant geographical location part premise relevant business service carried otherwise provided (2) paragraph (1) penal provision purpose section 31a act 1947 (3) avoidance doubt paragraph (1) prohibit - 6 206 (a) (b) filming recording performance theatre concert hall museum art gallery without audience present purpose broadcasting performance internet radio television holding horseracing greyhound racing racecourse person attendance racecourse solely purpose spectating racing (c) use premise part premise purpose - (i) (ii) meeting local authority (within meaning act 2001) sitting one house oireachtas committee thereof (within meaning section 2 house oireachtas (inquiries privilege procedures) act 2013 (no 33 2013) (4) regulation - relevant business service mean business service type specified schedule 2 relevant person relation relevant business service mean - (a) (b) (c) occupier manager person time charge premise part premise concerned 206 7 regulation 4

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 23. Convention and conference centres, other than insofar as they provide
text_raw:
23. Convention and conference centres, other than insofar as they provide 
essential accommodation facilities relating to the containment of Covid19.
text_norm: 23 convention conference centre insofar provide essential accommodation facility relating containment covid19

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 24. Hotels, caravan parks, camping grounds or similar accommodation
text_raw:
24. Hotels, caravan parks, camping grounds or similar accommodation 

services, other than insofar as they are providing - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

essential accommodation (including accommodation for homeless 
persons and persons in direct provision and persons who are unable 
to reside in their usual place of residence due to reasons related to 
the spread of Covid-19 or otherwise), 

accommodation for a person that is necessary for the purposes of 
his or her work or employment, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to attend a funeral, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to fulfil legal obligations, 

accommodation for a person that is necessary to permit or enable 
him or her to receive medical or dental treatment, or 

accommodation for a person that is necessary for vital family 
reasons.

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 25. Outlets selling food or beverages (including an outlet in relation to which
text_raw:
25. Outlets selling food or beverages (including an outlet in relation to which 
an on-licence (within the meaning of the Public Health (Alcohol) Act 
2018 (No. 24 of 2018) applies whether on a retail or wholesale basis and 
whether in a non-specialised or specialised outlet, other than - 

(a) 

(b) 

insofar as they sell food or beverages on a takeaway basis or for 
consumption off the premises, or 

staff canteens operating for the exclusive use of persons working 
in, or at, a particular premises.

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 28. Sports stadiums, campuses and sports training facilities other than insofar
text_raw:
28. Sports stadiums, campuses and sports training facilities other than insofar 
as the operation of such sports stadiums, campuses and sports training 
facilities is necessary for athletic use and training by persons specified in 
Regulation 5(4)(a) or by the coaching and support personnel of such 
persons. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Health, 

8 June, 2020. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Health.

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the unwinding of certain restrictions provided 
for in the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions)(Covid-19) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 121 of 2020), as amended, including the reopening 
of retail outlets and extending the distance that may be travelled for specified 
purposes. 

The Regulations also provide for continued restrictions for some businesses or 
services and for offences, including in relation to events. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [206] 13
